importantArticles.title: Airline stocks fall as consumers pull back on travel spending

importantArticles.headline: Heathrow Airport, one of the world's busiest, is closed today after a fire at an electrical substation nearby caused a massive power outage. The closure has sparked travel chaos across the globe, with over 1,300 flights already canceled. Following the news, travel and leisure stocks in the US and UK, including Delta (DAL) and British Airways parent International Airlines Group, are under pressure today. Tune in to The Morning Brief beginning at 9am ET with Brad Smith and Myles Udland for the latest developments.
importantArticles.title: Heathrow Airport shuts down after fire, traffic snarled

importantArticles.headline: A fire has broken out near London's Heathrow Airport, causing a power outage and leaving 200,000 global travelers stranded and canceling over 1,300 flights from the facility. The Morning Brief's Brad Smith monitors how this headline is impacting airline stocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
importantArticles.title: Fire closes London's Heathrow Airport, disrupting global travel

importantArticles.headline: American Airlines Group (NasdaqGS:AAL) saw its share price decline by 11% over the past week, which may be linked to recent market stressors, including a downgrade from Jefferies affecting airline stocks like AAL due to concerns over consumer sentiment and economic uncertainty. The airline sector has been under pressure as a result of broader market volatility tied to potential U.S. tariff announcements projected to influence macroeconomic factors.
